persons.name: LuigiGalvani
persons.description: Italian surgeon and anatomist who carried out experiments with electricity and animals. The term 'galvanism' was named after him

persons.name: AlessandroVolta
persons.description: Professor of experimental physics at the University of Pavia. At the end of the eighteenth century he Invented the Voltaic pile which produced electric current and which Davy shortly dubbed the battery. Davy described meeting him in 1814 in notebook 14/I, p.38. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: WilliamAllen
persons.description: Allen was a Quaker who worked in the pharmaceutical industry. Davy asked him to give lectures on natural philosophy at the RI. FRSL.

persons.name: Franz Ulrich TheodorAepinus
persons.description: German born natural philosopher who mostly worked in Russia. Best known for his researches, theoretical and experimental, in electricity and magnetism.

persons.name: HenryCavendish
persons.description: A central figure in English natural philosophy and chemistry, among other research he determined the density of the earth and discovered what would later be named hydrogen. He was one of the people who helped appoint Davy to the Royal Institution. Following his death in 1810 Davy delivered a widely-quoted eulogy on Cavendish and later arranged for some of his apparatus to be transferred to the Royal Institution. FRSL.

persons.name: HenryCavendish
persons.description: A central figure in English natural philosophy and chemistry, among other research he determined the density of the earth and discovered what would later be named hydrogen. He was one of the people who helped appoint Davy to the Royal Institution. Following his death in 1810 Davy delivered a widely-quoted eulogy on Cavendish and later arranged for some of his apparatus to be transferred to the Royal Institution. FRSL.

persons.name: EdwardNairne
persons.description: Possibly the most well known scientific instrument maker of his time. Worked closely with Franklin, Priestley and Cavendish. 'Nairne's Machine' referred to his patented electrostatic generator, which was intended to treat a variety of medicinal ailments via electrical shocks. FRSL.

persons.name: BenjaminFranklin
persons.description: Man of science born in Philadelphia. Inventor, printer, publisher, political philosopher, and a Founding Father of the United States. FRSL.

persons.name: IsaacNewton
persons.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

persons.name: AbrahamBennet
persons.description: Natural philosopher and close associate with Priestley, Darwin and Wedgwood. He recorded atmospheric electricity. FRSL.

works.name: Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London
works.author: Abraham Bennet

works.author: Johann Georg Sulzer

persons.name: Giovanni Valentino MattiaFabbroni
persons.description: Italian naturalist, economist, agronomist and chemist.
